alston.minecraft

Class Block

  • java.lang.Object
    • alston.minecraft.Block
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CraftingTable, Torch

    public class Block
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Used to represent the smallest unit of 3D mesurement in the Game, the equivilent of a voxel (volume-pixel), each mesuring exactly 1m*1m*1m. Includes the visual representation of every Block by containing all the appropriate JME Objects, and handles all interactions between them, including optimization.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Block(int x, int y, int z, Chunk parent)
      Constuctor of Block; creates an Air Block (this constructor should be used only to create chunks).
      Block(com.jme3.material.Material material, int type, int base)
      Creates a prototype of a plain Block (non-subtype), with the drop type being the same as the Block type.
      Block(com.jme3.material.Material material, int type, int dropType, int base)
      Creates a prototype of a plain Block (non-subtype), with a specified drop type.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Block

        public Block(int x,
     int y,
     int z,
     Chunk parent)
        Constuctor of Block; creates an Air Block (this constructor should be used only to create chunks). Instaniates all the necessary Objects/varibles as well as assign it from the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of the Block
        y - Y coordinate of the Block
        z - Z coordinate of the Block
        parent - The Chunk that the Block belongs to

      • Block

        public Block(com.jme3.material.Material material,
     int type,
     int base)
        Creates a prototype of a plain Block (non-subtype), with the drop type being the same as the Block type.
        Parameters:
        material - The material for the Spatial
        type - Type of Block
        base - The base of the Block

      • Block

        public Block(com.jme3.material.Material material,
     int type,
     int dropType,
     int base)
        Creates a prototype of a plain Block (non-subtype), with a specified drop type.
        Parameters:
        material - The material for the Spatial
        type - Type of Block
        dropType - What the Block will drop when broken; or ITEM.NAN for nothing
        base - The base of the Block

    • Method Detail

      • changeToBlock

        public void changeToBlock(int type,
                 boolean updatePhysics)
        Changes the Block's type to something else. For efficency purposes, It simply changes the relevant values, and only replaces with an entirely new Block when determines necessary by the Factory.
        Parameters:
        type - The new type of the block
        updatePhysics - If the physics should be updated afterwards (Should be false only when generating terrain to optimize time)

      • checkBlockForShowing

        public void checkBlockForShowing()
        Checks this block for surrounding Air Blocks. If one is found, the Block will show.

      • show

        protected void show()
        Adds the block to the Chunk's node and marks it as not hidden.

      • restore

        public void restore()
        Restores the Block's memory intensive Objects (Spatial and Material); called to de-compress when LOADING A CHUNK.

      • setupFromFile

        public void setupFromFile(Chunk parent)
        Sets up the Block's spatial and material from loading from a file
        Parameters:
        parent - A refrence to the Chunk that this belongs to (Bug workaround)

      • compress

        public void compress()
        Sets the memory intensive variables to a null refrence so the Objects are eligible for Garbage Collection and free up RAM.

        Returns:
        The health of the block

        Returns:
        If the Block is currently not rendered

      • setLightLevel

        public final void setLightLevel(float lightLevel)
        Note: In order for the effects to be applied, call updateVertices()
        Parameters:
        lightLevel - A positive floating point value, with the higher being brighter

      • updateVertices

        public final void updateVertices()
        Update the vertex colors of the Mesh of the Spatial and updates the memoization.

      • setHealth

        public void setHealth(float health)
        Parameters:
        health - The new health of the block.

      • resetHealth

        public void resetHealth()
        Resets the health of the Block to the protoype's.

      • setSpatial

        public void setSpatial(com.jme3.scene.Spatial spatial)
        Used for non-Cube Blocks only
        Parameters:
        spatial - The new Geometry of this Block

      • setTransparent

        public void setTransparent(boolean transparent)
        Parameters:
        transparent - If the Block is transparent

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(int x,
               int y,
               int z,
               Chunk parent)
        Puts the block in the specified location within the specified chunk.
        Parameters:
        x - The new X coordinate
        y - The new Y coordinate
        z - The new Z coordinate
        parent - The Chunk that the Block will go in
